issue.title: [C++] Upgrade default LLVM version to 10
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-9081](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-9081). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
Upgrade llvm dependencies to default to version 10.

There are several obstacles here, as apt

https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/7323

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-9081?focusedCommentId=17136073) by Neal Richardson (npr):*
Does this need to happen for 1.0? Seems a little late to be upgrading major dependencies.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-9081?focusedCommentId=17191791) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
Is this critical? Apart from Gandiva, we have no important feature relying on LLVM. I'd let the Gandiva developers choose when to bump the dependency.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-9081?focusedCommentId=17560369) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
We now rely on clang tools 12.x, and LLVM 11.x for Gandiva.
